root.name: cache
tip: Inspect and manage pip's wheel cache.

next.name: list
tip: List filenames of packages stored in the cache.
<pattern> can be a glob expression or a package name.

options.name: --format
tip: Select the output format among: human (default) or abspath.

next.name: purge
tip: Remove all items from the cache.

next.name: remove
tip: Remove one or more package from the cache.

root.name: check
tip: Verify installed packages have compatible dependencies.

root.name: completion
tip: A helper command used for command completion.

options.name: --editor
tip: Editor to use to edit the file.
Uses VISUAL or EDITOR environment variables if not provided.

options.name: --global
tip: Use the system-wide configuration file only.

options.name: --site
tip: Use the current environment configuration file only.

options.name: --user
tip: Use the user configuration file only.

next.name: debug
tip: List the configuration files and values defined under them.

next.name: edit
tip: Edit the configuration file in an editor.

next.name: get
tip: Get the value associated with command.option

next.name: list
tip: List the active configuration (or from the file specified)

next.name: unset
tip: Unset the value associated with command.option

root.name: freeze
tip: Output installed packages in requirements format.
packages are listed in a case-insensitive sorted order.

options.name: --all
tip: Do not skip these packages in the output: wheel, pip, setuptools, distribute

root.name: hash
tip: These can be used with --hash in a requirements file to do repeatable installs.

options.name: --algorithm
tip: The hash algorithm to use: one of sha256, sha384, sha512

root.name: index
tip: Inspect information available from package indexes.

root.name: inspect
tip: Inspect the content of a Python environment and produce a report in JSON format.

options.name: --compile
tip: Compile Python source files to bytecode.

options.name: --dry-run
tip: Don't actually install anything, just print what would be.
Can be used in combination with --ignore-installed to 'resolve' the requirements.

options.name: --force-reinstall
tip: Reinstall all packages even if they are already up-to-date.

options.name: --ignore-installed
tip: Ignore the installed packages, overwriting them.
This can break your system if the existing package is of a different version or was installed with a different package manager!

options.name: --install-option
tip: Extra arguments to be supplied to the setup.py install command (use like --install-option="--install-scripts=/usr/local/bin").
You can use multiple --install-option options to pass multiple options to setup.py install.
If you are using an option with a directory path, be sure to use absolute path.

options.name: --no-compile
tip: Don't compile Python source files to bytecode.

options.name: --no-warn-script-location
tip: Don't warn when installing scripts outside PATH.

options.name: --prefix
tip: Installation prefix where lib, bin and other top-level folders are placed

options.name: --target
tip: Install packages into the given directory.
By default this will not replace existing files/folders in the given directory.
Use --upgrade to replace existing packages in the given directory with new versions.

options.name: --upgrade
tip: Upgrade all specified packages to the newest available version.
The handling of dependencies depends on the upgrade-strategy used.

options.name: --upgrade-strategy
tip: Determines how dependency upgrading should be handled [default: only-if-needed].
"eager"          - dependencies are upgraded regardless of whether the currently installed version satisfies the requirements of the upgraded package(s).
"only-if-needed" - are upgraded only when they do not satisfy the requirements of the upgraded package(s).

options.name: --user
tip: Install to the Python user install directory for your platform.
(See the Python documentation for site.USER_BASE for full details.)

options.name: --format
tip: Select the output format among: columns (default), freeze, or json

options.name: --not-required
tip: List packages that are not dependencies of installed packages.

options.name: --index
tip: Base URL of Python Package Index (default https://pypi.org/pypi)

root.name: show
tip: The output is in RFC-compliant mail header format.

options.name: --files
tip: Show the full list of installed files for each package.

options.name: --yes
tip: Don't ask for confirmation of uninstall deletions.

root.name: wheel
tip: Build Wheel archives for your requirements and dependencies.

options.name: --build-option
tip: Extra arguments to be supplied to 'setup.py bdist_wheel'.

options.name: --no-verify
tip: Don't verify if built wheel is valid.

options.name: --wheel-dir
tip: Build wheels into <dir>, where the default is the current working directory.

common_options.name: --cert
tip: Path to PEM-encoded CA certificate bundle. If provided, overrides the default.
See 'SSL Certificate Verification' in pip documentation for more information.

common_options.name: --client-cert
tip: Path to SSL client certificate, a single file containing the private key and the certificate in PEM format.

common_options.name: --debug
tip: Let unhandled exceptions propagate outside the main subroutine, instead of logging them to stderr.

common_options.name: --disable-pip-version-check
tip: Don't periodically check PyPI to determine whether a new version of pip is available for download.

common_options.name: --exists-action
tip: Default action when a path already exists: (s)witch, (i)gnore, (w)ipe, (b)ackup, (a)bort.

common_options.name: --isolated
tip: Run pip in an isolated mode, ignoring environment variables and user configuration.

common_options.name: --log
tip: Path to a verbose appending log.

common_options.name: --no-python-version-warning
tip: Silence deprecation warnings for upcoming unsupported Pythons.

common_options.name: --proxy
tip: Specify a proxy in the form [user:password@]proxy.server:port.

common_options.name: --python
tip: pip with the specified Python interpreter.

common_options.name: --quiet
tip: Give less output. Option is additive, and can be used up to 3 times.
(corresponding to WARNING, ERROR, and CRITICAL logging levels).

common_options.name: --require-virtualenv
tip: Allow pip to only run in a virtual environment; exit with an error otherwise.

common_options.name: --retries
tip: Maximum number of retries each connection should attempt (default 5 times).

common_options.name: --trusted-host
tip: Mark this host or host:port pair as trusted, even though it does not have valid or any HTTPS.

common_options.name: --use-deprecated
tip: Enable deprecated functionality, that will be removed in the future.

common_options.name: --use-feature
tip: Enable new functionality, that may be backward incompatible.

common_options.name: --verbose
tip: Give more output. Option is additive, and can be used up to 3 times.

__abi: Only use wheels compatible with Python abi <abi>, e.g. 'pypy_41'. If not specified, then the current interpreter abi tag is used.
Use this option multiple times to specify multiple abis supported by the target interpreter.
Generally you will need to specify --implementation, --platform, and --python-version when using this option.
info.__check_build_dependencies: Check the build dependencies when PEP517 is used.
__config_settings:
U: --config-setting <settings>
Configuration settings to be passed to the PEP 517 build backend.
Settings take the form KEY=VALUE.
Use multiple --config-settings options to pass multiple keys to the backend.
__constraint: Constrain versions using the given constraints file. This option can be used multiple times.
__editable: Install a project in editable mode(e.g. setuptools "develop mode") from a local project path or a VCS url
__exclude: Exclude specified package from the output.
__extra_index_url:
U: --extra-index-url <url>
Extra URLs of package indexes to use in addition to --index-url.
Should follow the same rules as --index-url.
__find_links:
If a URL or path to an html file, then parse for links to archives such as sdist (.tar.gz) or wheel (.whl) files.
If a local path or file:// URL that's a directory, then look for archives in the directory listing.
Links to VCS project URLs are not supported.
__global_option: Extra global options to be supplied to the setup.py call before the install or bdist_wheel command.
__implementation:
U: --implementation <implementation>
Only use wheels compatible with Python implementation <implementation>, e.g. 'pp', 'jy', 'cp',  or 'ip'.
If not specified, then the current interpreter implementation is used. Use 'py' to force implementation-agnostic wheels.
__index_url: Base URL of the Python Package Index (default https://pypi.org/simple).
This should point to a repository compliant with PEP 503 (the simple repository API) or a local directory laid out in the same format.
__local: If in a virtualenv that has global access, do not list globally-installed packages.
__no_binary:
U: --no-binary <format_control>
Do not use binary packages. Can be supplied multiple times, and each time adds to the existing value.
Accepts either ":all:" to disable all binary packages, ":none:" to empty the set (notice the colons), or one or more package names with commas between them (no colons).
Note that some packages are tricky to compile and may fail to install when this option is used on them.
__no_build_isolation: Disable isolation when building a modern source distribution.
Build dependencies specified by PEP 518 must be already installed if this option is used.
info.__no_index: Ignore package index (only looking at --find-links URLs instead).
__only_binary:
U: --only-binary <format_control>
Do not use source packages. Can be supplied multiple times, and each time adds to the existing value.
Accepts either ":all:" to disable all source packages, ":none:" to empty the set, or one or more package names with commas between them.
Packages without binary distributions will fail to install when this option is used on them.
__path: Restrict to the specified installation path for listing packages (can be used multiple times).
__platform:
U: --platform <platform>
Only use wheels compatible with <platform>.
Defaults to the platform of the running system.
Use this option multiple times to specify multiple platforms supported by the target interpreter.
info.__pre: Include pre-release and development versions. By default, pip only finds stable versions.
info.__prefer_binary: Prefer older binary packages over newer source packages.
__progress_bar: Specify whether the progress bar should be used [on, off] (default: on)
__python_version:
U: --python-version <version>
The Python interpreter version to use for wheel and "Requires-Python" compatibility checks.
Defaults to a version derived from the running interpreter.
__report:
U: --report <file>
Generate a JSON file describing what pip did to install the provided requirements.
Can be used in combination with --dry-run and --ignore-installed to 'resolve' the requirements.
When - is used as file name it writes to stdout.When writing to stdout, please combine with the --quiet option to avoid mixing pip logging output with JSON output.
__require_hashes: Require a hash to check each requirement against, for repeatable installs.
This option is implied when any package in a requirements file has a --hash option.
__requirement:
U: -r, --requirement <file>
Use the order in the given requirements file and its comments when generating output.
This option can be used multiple times.
__root: Install everything relative to this alternate root directory.
__root_user_action:
U: --root-user-action <root_user_action>
Action if pip is run as a root user.
By default, a warning message is shown.
__src:
U: --src <dir>
Directory to check out editable projects into.
The default in a virtualenv is "<venv path>/src".
The default for global installs is "<current dir>/src".
info.__use_pep517: Use PEP 517 for building source distributions (use --no-use-pep517 to force legacy behaviour).
info.__user: Only output packages installed in user-site.
